name: denovotranscript-de-novo-transcriptome
title: De Novo Transcriptome Assembly
description: Comprehensive pipeline for de novo transcriptome assembly of RNA-seq data without a reference genome
content:
De Novo Transcriptome Assembly

A comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for de novo transcriptome assembly of paired-end short reads from bulk RNA-seq data.

Pipeline Overview

This nf-core pipeline performs end-to-end transcriptome assembly and analysis without requiring a reference genome, making it ideal for non-model organisms or novel transcriptome discovery.

Key Features

  • Quality Control: FastQC for quality metrics and fastp for adapter trimming and quality filtering
  • rRNA Removal: SortMeRNA for removal of ribosomal RNA contamination (optional)
  • De Novo Assembly: Support for Trinity and rnaSPAdes assemblers
  • Redundancy Reduction: Evidential Gene tr2aacds for removing redundant transcripts
  • Quality Assessment: TransRate for comprehensive transcriptome quality evaluation
  • Quantification: Salmon for fast and accurate transcript expression quantification

Workflow Steps

  1. Read quality control and preprocessing
  2. Adapter trimming and quality filtering
  3. Optional ribosomal RNA removal
  4. De novo transcriptome assembly
  5. Redundancy reduction and filtering
  6. Transcriptome quality assessment
  7. Pseudo-alignment and quantification
  8. MultiQC report generation

Input Requirements

Provide a samplesheet (CSV/TSV format) containing:

  • Sample identifiers
  • Paths to paired-end FASTQ files (read 1 and read 2)
  • Optional strandedness information

Output Files

The pipeline generates:

  • Assembled transcriptome in FASTA format
  • Quality control reports (FastQC, MultiQC)
  • TransRate assembly quality metrics
  • Salmon quantification results
  • Gene expression matrices

Note: This pipeline is ideal for non-model organisms, transcriptome discovery, or when a high-quality reference genome is not available.
